Posts.Content: Hi My daughter is having her chemo treatment,  and has a  very dry mouth with a foul taste - has anyone found any good treatment for this?
Posts.Title: lynzilou

Posts.Content: Hi My daughter had the back flap recon.  It is not really the right size, the surgeon says that it will drop, but even if it does, it isn't going to be the same size.   The thing is, we have got the results  from the mx next Monday , then we have to see the oncologist to arrange chemo, so the cosmetic appearance is not so important right now.   It's just distressing for my daughter when she looks in the mirror. She still has the drains in, which are really uncomfortable, and the muscle which they transferred from her back twitches every time she sneezes - have you read about that during your research?  There is so much going on all the time isn't there?  You think that the mx is the end of the upheaval, but there are extras!! In the meantime we are dreading Monday - each time we hae been to see him he has had disturbing news............ Thanks for your help Love Lyn x
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi, this is the first time I have done this.  My daughter is going to have a mastectomy on Tuesday.   I expect everyone here will know the horror of this.  Does anyone know where we can buy a button front  top with pockets for the 2 sets of drains she will have for about 2 weeks please? Any ideas?  Thanks x
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne Thank you so much for your reply.  What you have advised is really useful, and  two sizes too big makes sense because my daughter is going to have two sets of drains, front and back. I saw an American site on Google which had special tops with pockets at the hem to carry the drains, but I can;t find anything in the UK which is similar,  but I suppose I can save a bit by using a supermarket plastic bag!  Thank you for that tip! I suppose she will be sore and restricted in movement for quite a while?  When you say "my hospital" - is it as a patient or nurse/doc? Thank you for your good wishes, I really do appreciate your contact. Lynxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, Thank you for replying.  I feel for you so much.  I know how Monday is inching forward for you and  how nervous you are.    I have been counting down the days until Tuesday 25th from the time that the specialist gave us the date.   It's a progression of dates and hurdles isn't it?  It has to be done, and you want that caancer out of your body,  Monday isn't too far away for you now, and once it is done, that will be another hurdle over for you.   The sooner it comes now, the better, then that bit is over with.  Our hospital doesn't have any of the bags, - so I bought a toilet bag from Boots with a drawstring because it sounded like the sort of thing they would have provided.   One lady advised me that the Primark bags with the long handles are good for holding the drains, and someone else said that a simple shoulder bag , just like a pocket with no fastening, keeps the drains low down where they can work best. Good luck for Monday, keep strong xxx Love Lyn
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Barbara, Thank you for replying, it is lovely to hear from you and your positive attitude.  I think my daughter will be in longer and she is going to have two sets of drains,  because she is having a back flap recon at the same time. I so agree with you about getting rid of the lump, we feel the same way and just want it out.  It's great news that your lymph nodes are clear, that must be such a relief for you. And chemo - yes, horrible to go through, but you know that it is really finishing off everything else.  And, I suppose the Winter is the best time to be wearing a wig with it being cold! The very best of good luck to you, keep positive, Love Lyn xxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Lilybeth That sounds like a great idea - I've got a couple of those upstairs - nice and cheerful too.  How long did your drains stay in?  My daughter's oncologist says they will be in for 2 weeks, and the district nurse will come round whilst they are in. Thank you Lyn
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Debra I have got a p.s.!  I have just ordered the Royce Lingerie bra for my daughter - you're right, it looks perfect - thank you Love Lynx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Yvonne & Debra, Thank you both so much, you have even made me smile between you!!  We have to be at the hospital at 7.30 am, so I am going to bed now, whether I will sleep is another matter........ You both have said such sensible things and has given me comfort, so thank you again. Lyn xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Debra The Royce bra has arrived, and it looks lovely and soft.   Whilst we were waiting this morning - at 7.30 - I was telling my daughter about you confusing the morphine pump with the light switch - it brought a smile - and also to the other anxious patients sitting in the waiting room waiting for their ops.!! I have just phoned the ward, but she is still in theatre - that's 4 and half hours so far, and the nurse said she will probably be in recovery for a couple of hours afterwards, so we may not be able to see her for the 3.30pm visitng time and have to wait for tonight. How did your mum cope?  I am finding it so difficult too.  It should be me, not my daughter. It's great that you did not have a lot of side effects with chemo - we have been told about ladies who have been sick all day long and so tired they can only lie on the settee all day - I suppose it's a lot to do with how you view it all, you have such a positive attitude - are there different types of chemo?   I don't know a lot about that stage, I have had enough problems trying to come to terms with the mastectomy. Talking to you is good therapy - thank you for taking the time and trouble, I do so appreciate it. Love Lynxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Thank you for your kind words.  I am so sorry that you lost your Mum - my own Mum died when she was only 51 (not from cancer), and the loss of that one - most special person - stays with you for ever.  We really have to value every single day don't we?  You just don't know what life is going to throw at you.  Are you going to have a recon?  I know what you mean about being a carer, you just think about the person you are caring for, and your own wishes, health are completely unimportant.  But it's true, you have to eat and sleep and regain your strength for the following day. Thank you Sue. Love Lynxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Yvonne, I don't think I could cope with being a Mum to you lot as well!!!! I have not long come back from the hospital, my daughter is having a blood transfusion because she lost so much blood during the op.   you get over one thing, and then something else comes and smacks you in the face! She is very tired today, but I hope that when the fresh blood is into her and she has a good night's sleep, she will be stronger tomorrow. Thank you for your kind words, they really do help Love Lyn xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Oh Helen - Thank You, that does reassure me.  It was such a shock to see the tubes and blood and stuff today.  The nurses said that she will feel better once the transfusion is complete. How is your recon now?  My daughter had a single mastectomy and is  upset that she is lopsided and the size is different too. Thank you again for your good wishes. Lyn xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne,  How are things going with you now?  I haven't heard from you in a while.... My daughter has still got the drains in, over a week later, and thankfully, the fluid seems to be less consistently.  In the first couple of days, one of the drains was less, and you are optimistic, then the following day it's back up again!    I agree that it is best to keep the drains in as long as possible, the alternative is for the district nurse to extract the fluid daily with a syringe - and needles are not our favourite item in the world - I know you agree with that! We saw the surgeon on Wednesday, and he is happy with his work, altho' the recon is a completely different size and shape.  We are having the post mx results next Monday, so once again, we are counting down the days and waiting........... there is such a lot of waiting isn't there? How are you doing at the moment? Love Lyn xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Debra Thank you for replying, the Primark bag sounds great, such an easy solution!  The doc says the drains will be in for about 2 weeks, so a bag that goes over the shoulder is a great idea, does it get quite heavy when it fills up? Also, a chair by the side of the bed is a good idea.   My daughter is worried about sleeping because she is having the back flap recon. op at the same time as the mastectomy, so her back as well as her front is going to be sore - the drains on a chair is one less thing to worry about. You sound so positive Debra, thank you xxx Love Lyn
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Thanks Yvonne - I wasn't meaning to be rude when I said "my hospital"!!!   You just sounded as though you knew what you were talking about, I am so sorry that it's thru' personal experience.  You sound very positive and it seems as tho' you have lots of people who love you.   To have full movement after 8 weeks is very good isn;t it?  and no pain from the surgery is even better.  How long will you have chemo?  Are you using the ice cap they have told my daughter about?  She has had her lovely long hair cut short in preparation, the ice cap seems to work for some people. But you are so right in what you say, the chemo gets rid of any cancer that might be left in your body, and, at the end of it, you are fit and well, and your hair grows back. Your replies have given me comfort,  thank you so much, Good luck to you, Thank you again, Love Lynx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Rose, Thank you for taking the trouble to reply.  What you have said is really useful.  I wonder if my daughter will get  the little peg things, they sound like a really good idea, and I will tell her about having the drains as low as possible, that is good advice too. She had a lumpectomy originally and she did all the arm exercises afterwards religiously, so I know she will do everything she is told to help herself as much as possible.  Amazing that you did Zumba 8 days after!!    my daughter loves Zumba, I will tell her about you - that will give her hope - thank you for that, it will make her smile! I know about the emotional side........ Keep strong Sascha and thank you again Love Lynx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Thank you Debra, that is such a useful lot of info.  It's  nice for me to talk to someone who has had the same op and come through the other side, I can't seem to see or think beyond Tuesday. I did think that a front fastening bra would be easier for my daughter, I'll investigate the Royce Lingerie one. Good tip about the drain bags, thank you again.  Also the radio and headphones - excellent idea, the hours in hospital seem to be longer than at home don't they? I keep telling my daughter that it will be better after the mastectomy for exactly the same reasons as you have said - get it out of her and let; us keep her. Paragraphs?  they are the least of my worries! Thank you Debra again, "talking" to you is a great help. Love Lyn xxx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, Just seen your message now.  I have not long come back from the hospital.  My daughter was five hours in theatre and three and half hours in recovery.  As you so rightly said, she was completely unaware of everything that was going on, but I was sitting (pacing) in the waiting room, after the nurse had said she would be back on the ward in half an hour, but it was  two hours later when she was wheeled past. You know how it is, your imagination plays havoc.  It was SUCH a relief to see her. The recon and stiches are good, and my daughter, altho' completely disorientated and shattered, was smiling and kept lifting up her gown to have a look! I feel as tho' someone has grabbed me by the ankles and bashed me back and fore against a tree! Thank you SO MUCH for your kind , and wise words.  the comfort you have given me is immense. Yes, you are right, one step at a time, we have to "gird our loins" for the next assault, but in the meantime, enjoy the healing process. Thank you, Yvonne, again, Lyn xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Tops with Drain Pockets

Posts.Content: Hi Debra Thanks for your message.  My daughter  is having to have a blood transfusion because she lost so much blood during the op.  She is very drained and tired, but I told her about your recon/tumble dryer story and it made her laugh. It must have been so difficult for your Mum to hear that word again after your Dad dying,  it makes you realise that you have to appreciate  every single day you are given, because you just do not know what is around the corner. I am hoping that my daughter will sleep tonight - she has got her earplugs because  the snoring on the ward kept her from sleeping last night - and once she has had the remainder of the blood top up, she should get some energy back. Yes, I agree, we will tackle the Chemo situation when it comes, no point in  worrying about it yet. Thank you for your thoughts and caring, I do appreciate it. Love Lyn xx
